[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Data Entry System (DES) defines requirements for structured data entry, real-time validation, and Excel-format compatibility while ensuring compliance with document formatting standards.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DES supports accurate data input, structured validation, batch processing, and seamless integration with Excel templates.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DES integrates with document storage, validation services, and Excel import/export modules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DES provides a structured UI closely resembling Microsoft Excel forms for ease of use.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DES operates on desktop, web, and tablet environments with support for external data sources.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DES utilizes React.js for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, PostgreSQL for structured data storage, and Redis for caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DES supports real-time validation via REST APIs and WebSockets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DES optimizes memory use for handling high-volume data entry without performance degradation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DES ensures real-time validation, structured data storage, and seamless document integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DES supports both cloud-based access and offline-enabled entry with synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DES links to authentication, validation services, and Excel-based document storage.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DES facilitates structured data entry, Excel import/export, and validation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DES is designed for data entry personnel accustomed to Microsoft Excel workflows.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DES requires accurate alignment with predefined hardcopy forms and validation rules.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DES relies on accurate form specifications, real-time validation APIs, and document integration services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Hardcopy Form: Printed data entry template.
Excel-Like UI: Structured interface mirroring Microsoft Excel.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide a UI closely resembling Microsoft Excel hardcopy forms.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support real-time validation to maintain data consistency.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall ensure all data entry fields match their Excel hardcopy equivalents while maintaining structured validation (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to TO-BE-DEFINED (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support batch data entry, ensuring error-free processing of up to 100 records in a single session.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall maintain an Excel-like UI to ensure ease of use for data entry personnel.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall load individual forms within 3 seconds and support batch entry processing within 10 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store form configurations, field mappings, and validation logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall align its UI with predefined hardcopy form templates and Excel-based layouts.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with document formatting, validation, and accessibility standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure real-time validation, structured data storage, and consistent synchronization with document storage systems.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Form layout compliance, real-time validation, and batch data processing shall be tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Form design guidelines, Excel integration documentation, and validation policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Best practices for UI design, document formatting standards, and structured data validation.
